questions.text: Which SQL keyword is used to retrieve data from a database?
questions.Explanation: SELECT is used to query data from a database.

questions.text: Which SQL clause is used to filter records?
questions.Explanation: WHERE filters rows before grouping or ordering.

questions.text: Which SQL clause is used to sort the result set?
questions.Explanation: ORDER BY is used to sort results ascending or descending.

questions.text: Which SQL statement is used to add new rows?
questions.Explanation: INSERT is used to add new records to a table.

questions.text: Which SQL keyword removes duplicate records?
questions.Explanation: DISTINCT returns only unique values.

questions.text: Which SQL aggregate function counts rows?
questions.Explanation: COUNT() returns the number of rows.

questions.text: Which SQL keyword combines results of two queries?
questions.Explanation: UNION combines results of two SELECT statements.

questions.text: Which SQL join returns all rows from the left table and matched rows from the right?
questions.Explanation: LEFT JOIN returns all left rows, and matching right rows.

questions.text: Which SQL command is used to change data in a table?
questions.Explanation: UPDATE changes existing records in a table.

questions.text: Which SQL keyword is used to delete all rows from a table?
questions.Explanation: TRUNCATE removes all rows but keeps the structure.

questions.text: Which SQL command removes a table completely?
questions.Explanation: DROP deletes the table and its data permanently.

questions.text: Which SQL constraint ensures unique values in a column?
questions.Explanation: UNIQUE ensures all values in a column are different.

questions.text: Which SQL keyword groups rows by column values?
questions.Explanation: GROUP BY groups rows that share values.

questions.text: Which SQL clause is used with GROUP BY to filter groups?
questions.Explanation: HAVING filters groups after aggregation.

questions.text: Which SQL keyword checks for missing values?
questions.Explanation: IS NULL is used to test for NULL values.

questions.text: Which SQL function returns the average value?
questions.Explanation: AVG() calculates the mean value of a column.

questions.text: Which SQL command creates a new table?
questions.Explanation: CREATE TABLE defines a new table and its columns.

questions.text: Which SQL command is used to add a column?
questions.Explanation: ALTER TABLE ADD is used to add a column.

questions.text: Which SQL command adds an index to a table?
questions.Explanation: CREATE INDEX improves search performance.

questions.text: Which SQL keyword is used to return only rows that satisfy both queries?
questions.Explanation: INTERSECT returns rows common to both queries.
